result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thadous Levelle Beard Jr

defendant.name: Beard, Thadous Levelle, Jr
defendant.address: 1344 West Hadley Street Apt. A, Milwaukee, WI 53206

records.addlTxt: Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case 21CF003011 for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant Thadous Levelle Beard Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms in court for Thadous Levelle Beard Jr.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for Status Conference this date.  Defendant previously filed Request for Substitution.  Defendant withdraws request.  Court accepts withdrawal.
Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court, defendant Thadous Levelle Beard not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of today's hearing.
Court is advised that defendant was convicted as to Case# 21CF03011 in Branch 12.

Further, Court is advised this case may be read-in as to sentencing on Case# 21CF03011.
Court orders this case adjourned for status in Branch 12 on the next court date as to Case# 21CF03011.

Clerk:  jms
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (25 pages) commencing 03-04-2022 by Danielle Holcomb.

Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court, defendant Thadous Levelle Beard not in court, in custody appearance waived.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference. The scheduling conference was held in person.  Defense is requesting a status conference date.  The court will grant defense request and order the matter adjourned to Branch 28.
  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Thadous Levelle Beard in court with attorney Jeff Schwarz for Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Thadous Levelle Beard in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Defense requests an adjourned Scheduling Conference date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Arraignment scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Borowski.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Rothstein, Br. 25.

Defendant Thadous Levelle Beard in court with Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons; both appear by video.  Defendant Thadous Levelle Beard in custody.  Paul Tiffin appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Emanuelson. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  State requests an arraignment. Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Arraignment scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Substitution to be addressed at the Preliminary Hearing.  bm.

Defendant Thadous Levelle Beard in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Thadous Levelle Beard in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case to follow Defendan't other matter pending before the Court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CTA dob 8/19/89
